alert.note: Alert for Lower Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 3:57PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT SUSSEX...SOUTHEASTERN KENT... OCEAN...CAMDEN...MERCER...SOUTHEASTERN SOMERSET...ATLANTIC... CUMBERLAND...EAST CENTRAL SALEM...SOUTHEASTERN GLOUCESTER...CAPE MAY...BURLINGTON...MONMOUTH...MIDDLESEX AND SOUTHEASTERN BUCKS COUNTIES... At 356 PM EST, an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from near Manville to near Seaford. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. Wind gusts up to 50 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Trenton, Vineland, New Brunswick, Atlantic City, Dover, Long Branch, Millville, Bridgeton, Asbury Park, Somerville, Ocean City, Georgetown, Cape May, Somerset, Cumberland, Lakewood, Cherry Hill, Old Bridge and Jackson. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 10. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 358 and 359. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 34. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 33 and 71. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 15. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 0 and 117, and between mile markers 119 and 124. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 0 and 44. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
